intro: Centaurea aristata, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and striking blue or purple flowers. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, with the central disk being tubular. Centaurea aristata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
